metadata.title: CVE-2022-32981 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.18.3 on powerpc32-bit platforms. There is a buffer overflow in ptrace PEEKUSER andPOKEUSER (aka PEEKUSR and POKEUSR) when accessing floating point registers.

criterions.comment: linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11').
linux-hwe-5.11: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.13').
linux-aws-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.11').
linux-azure-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.11').
linux-gcp-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.11').
linux-oracle-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.11').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/focal is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/focal is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/focal is affected and may need fixing.
